subject: Re: [junit] Possible bug with @Ignore @BeforeClass?
msgSnippet: ... ...spit out a warning message that @Before/@After code was skipped with an @Ignore annotation, and perhaps I should consider removing the method. I suspect
messageBody:
David Saff wrote:

> As a test writer, when I mark a setup method @Ignore @BeforeClass, I
> want my test runner to...
...spit out a warning message that @Before/@After code was skipped with
an @Ignore annotation, and perhaps I should consider removing the method.

I suspect you don't want to get into "JUnit lint" territory, but at the
same time, users are quite logically trying to use @Ignore in a context
you didn't intend, but that nevertheless makes sense to them, and in
general.

If @Ignore-ing a @Test stops the test from running, then why doesn't
@Ignore-ing a @Before stop the before from running? This is, perhaps,
why I wouldn't support @Ignore, but would rather just ask the test
writer to remove the @Test annotation when he doesn't want the test to
run. I don't know that @Ignore provides better results than removing the
@Test annotation temporarily.

Take care.
